document.docAuthor: Liu, Qin-Peng, Liu, Zi-Jun, Wang, Guo-Li & Yin, Zi-Xu
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the praying mantis subfamily Hierodulinae of China (Mantodea: Mantidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the praying mantis subfamily Hierodulinae of China (Mantodea: Mantidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: College of Landscape Architecture and Forestry, Qingdao Agricultural University, Qingdao, Shandong 266109, China.
College of Media, Qingdao University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, Shandong 266100, China
College of Fisheries, Ocean University of China, Qingdao, Shandong 266003, China

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Pcpl nearly smooth, without punctiform prominence; the first proximal discoidal spines distinctly short- er than the second; meso- and metafemora with an apical spine; paa apically with hook-like process as opposed to Archimantini .

Diversity and distribution. Burmeister (1838) listed 90 Mantodea species in 15 genera and firstly proposed
Hierodula
and
Rhombodera
as the subgenera of
Mantis Linnaeus, 1758
. Stål (1877) then gave
Hierodula
a special treatment but considered
Rhombodera
,
Sphodropoda
, and
Sphodromantis
as subgenera of the genus ( Roy 2014 ). Hierodulinae was originally erected as Hierodulae Brunner de Wattenwyl, 1893 and initially included
Hierodula
,
Rhombodera
,
Sphodropoda
, and
Arria (
Liu et al . 2020
)
. Giglio-Tos (1912) then undertook the necessary treatment of related groups and erected three new genera:
Hierodulella Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Ephierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
and
Parhierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
(=
Hierodula Burmeister, 1838
) and two new subgenera:
Rhomboderula
Giglio-Tos, 1912
in
Parhierodula
and
Rhomboderella
Giglio-Tos, 1912
in
Sphodromantis Stål, 1871
, and proposed five genera in Hierodulae Brunner de Wattenwyl 1893 . Thirteen new species in subgenus
Hierodula
, two new species in subgenus
Rhombodera
, thirteen new species in subgenus
Parhierodula
and three new species in subgenus
Rhomboderula
, and five new species in
Sphodromantis
were established by him at the same time. In 1917, Giglio-Tos then published four new species in the genus
Hierodula
and erected three new genera in his Hierodulae group. In the faunistic study of Indonesia by Werner in 1923, one new genus
Gretella Werner, 1923
and one new subgenus
Tamolanica Werner, 1923
of
Hierodula
were established in Mantinae . In 1927, Giglio-Tos posthumously published his first and the only book with identification keys for all mantids ( Roy 2014 ), which included fifty-six
Hierodula
species and ten genera in Hierodulae group:
Hierodula Burmeister, 1838
,
Sphodromantis Stål, 1871
,
Tarachomantis Brancsik, 1892
,
Hierodulella Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Ephierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Parhierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Pnigomantis Giglio-Tos, 1917
,
Camelomantis Giglio-Tos, 1917
,
Tisma Giglio-Tos, 1917
and
Alalomantis Giglio-Tos, 1917
. Beier (1935) listed
Hierodula , Rhomobodera
,
Sphodromantis
,
Rhomboderella
,
Camelomantis
,
Tamolanica Werner, 1923
, and
Zopheromantis Tindale, 1924
as subgenera of
Hierodula
, dropping
Parhierodula
into a synonym of
Tamolanica
and
Ephierodula
into a synonym of
Hierodula
.

In 1942, Beier erected a monotypic genus
Stictomantis Beier, 1942
to accommodate
Hierodula cinctipes Werner, 1916
. Beier presented his system of Mantodea in 1964, which included three tribes and fifty genera in subfamily Mantinae Latreille, 1802 ;
Sphodromantis
was elevated to genus from
Hierodula
by him at that time.

Roy (1973) published a synopsis of the mantids of Gabon . In this publication, he added tribes Polyspilotini and Paramantini to the Mantinae , establishing
Tismomorpha
Roy, 1973
in Paramantini . Schwarz & Roy (2018b) remove
Ephierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
from a synonymy of
Hierodula
. In the recent system by Schwarz & Roy (2019) ,
Sphodromantis
,
Tarachomantis
, and
Alalomantis
have been removed out of Hierodulinae . The tribe Hierodulini currently includes
Mekongomantis Schwarz et al ., 2018
,
Camelomantis Giglio-Tos, 1917
, Chlorocalis Stiewe, Shcherbakov & Vermeersch, 2019,
Tismomorpha Roy, 1973
,
Hierodulella Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Rhombomantis Ehrmann & Borer, 2015
,
Gretella Werner, 1923
,
Hierodula Burmeister, 1838
,
Ephierodula Giglio-Tos, 1912
,
Stictomantis Beier, 1942
,
Rhombodera Burmeister, 1838
,
Tamolanica Werner, 1923
and
Pnigomantis Giglio-Tos, 1917
.
Currently, fifteen genera with about 176 species, occur in the Oriental, Palaearctic, Australian and Afrotropical Regions.
